questions.question: Q1. What is one reason to click Object > Text Frame Options?

alternatives.alternative: to change the number of columns in a text frame
to apply a drop shadow to the frame
to change the corners of a frame from corner to rounded

to change the fill and stroke of a text frame

Ref.

questions.question: Q2. Which panel allows you to add an arrowhead to the end of a line?

alternatives.alternative: Effects
Stroke
Transform

Pathfinder

Ref.

questions.question: Q3. In the image shown, what do you know about the Body Text paragraph style?

alternatives.alternative: The selected text was not formatted using the style definition.
The selected text is in overset text outside the boundaries of the current frame.
The style has been applied to two or more paragraphs.

The style has been added since the master styles were created.

Ref.

questions.question: Q4. You want to ensure that an image on your page is exactly 25% of its original size. How can you determine whether the image is set to the desired size?

alternatives.alternative: Double-click the image with the Selection tool.
Select the graphic frame with the Selection tool.
Click Window > Info.
Click Object > Fitting.

questions.question: Q5. You have an empty one-page InDesign document. You have used File > Place to select a Word document that contains many pages of text. What will help you place the full story quickly?

alternatives.alternative: Select Show Import Options in the Place dialog box.
Right-click the page with the place cursor.
Shift-click with the place cursor inside the margin guides.
In the Pages panel, click the New Pages button with the place cursor.

questions.question: Q6. You select a graphic frame that contains a Photoshop image and use the Scale field in the Control panel to enlarge it to 200%. What happens to the effective image resolution?

alternatives.alternative: The resolution doubles.
Effective image resolution stays the same until you choose from the View > Display Performance menu.
Effective image resolution is set in Photoshop, not in InDesign, so it stays the same.
The resolution is cut in half.

questions.question: Q7. What is one reason you might want to use the Text Variables feature?

alternatives.alternative: to create captions underneath images that update automatically
to include calculations inside a dynamic table
to adjust text size automatically to fill the frame
to create running headers that include chapter names

questions.question: Q8. You want to place 4 of a multipage PDF into an InDesign document. What should you do?

alternatives.alternative: In the Place dialog box, select Show Import Options.
Import the PDF with the Media panel instead of File>Place
Open the PDF in Acrobat, select page 4, and drag it into InDesign.
After placing the PDF, disable the unwanted pages in the Media panel.

questions.question: Q9. Suppose that master page B is based on master page A, and you are currently editing master B. Which statement is true?

alternatives.alternative: Objects on master page A are not visible.
Objects on master page A must always appear behind objects from master page B.
Objects on master page A cannot be selected unless you override the objects.
Objects on master page A cannot be selected or changed.

questions.question: Q10. In the image shown, the text is on a path. You want to move the text farther to the right along the path. How can you accomplish this?

alternatives.alternative: Drag the blue square D.
Drag the side handle B
Drag the slanted line A.
Drag the center tick mark C.

questions.question: Q11. When you select a rectangular frame on the page, InDesign displays a yellow square near the frame's upper-right corner. What does this allow you to do?

alternatives.alternative: Change the corners from square to rounded.
Anchor the object into another frame.
Change teh layer or z-order of the frame.
Link the frame to another frame.

questions.question: Q12. What action can the Pen tool perform on a selected object?

alternatives.alternative: The Pen tool cannot affect an object after it has been created.
You can click a point to convert it to a curve.
You can drag the Pen tool inside a frame to convert it to a compound shape.
You can click a point to delete it.

questions.question: Q13. What is one reason you might want to use the Span Columns feature?

alternatives.alternative: You have a bullet list of six items that you want to split into two columns in the middle of a text frame.
You are changing the number of columns on a page and want to ensure the text flows properly.
You want a line or top shaded borded to span across the top of a multicolumn frame.
You have a heading that you want to span across two threaded text frames

questions.question: Q14. Which statement about tables is true?

alternatives.alternative: Tables are always anchored in a story in a text frame.
To edit text in a table, you should first click Table>Convert Table to Text
Tables must contain more than one cell.
Tables cannot be anchored in a story in a text frame

questions.question: Q15. Which feature would you use to create the effect shown, where the grouped circles blend with each other but not the object behind them?

alternatives.alternative: Global Light
the Screen blending mode
Isolate Blending
Knockout Group

questions.question: Q16. In the image shown, what do the colored frame edges indicate?

alternatives.alternative: which layer each object is on
which master page each object is on
which object style is applied to the frame
that the red frame is locked

questions.question: Q17. To resize any frame and its contents and maintain the proportions of both, which key or keys must you press while dragging from a corner handle?

alternatives.alternative: Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac)
Alt+Shift (Windows) or Option+Shift (Mac)
Ctrl+Shift (Windows) or Command+Shift (Mac)
Alt+Spacebar (Windows) or Options+Spacebar (Mac)

questions.question: Q18. In the image shown, what can you infer about how this document will print?

alternatives.alternative: The page wil be scaled to fit the paper.
All document layers will be visible
Some of the InDesign page will be cropped off.
The master page P is applied to the document pages.

questions.question: Q19. After you click a color stop in the Gradient panel to select it, how can you set its color to a swatch in the Swatches panel?

alternatives.alternative: Double-click the swatch.
Option-click (Mac) or Alt-click (Windows) the swatch.
You cannot apply a color swatch to a color stop in the Gradient panel.
Drag the color stop over the color in the Swatches panel.

questions.question: 20. Suppose you apply a gradient to a frame, then select New Gradient Swatch in the Swatches panel manu. Which feature is not saved in the gradient swatch?

alternatives.alternative: color mode (RGB or CMYK)
color stops
angle
type (linear or radial)

questions.question: 21. Which export format lets you gather viewer stats, such as number of views?

alternatives.alternative: Publish online
PDF (Interactive)
EPUB (Fixed Layout)
InDesign Snippet

questions.question: 22. You create an InDesign document with 1/8" bleed. After laying out the project, the printer calls to say that items in the document do not bleed. What is most likely the problem?

alternatives.alternative: You did not extend elements on the page to the bleed guide.
Image objects cannot bleed in InDesign.
Your printer is unable to print with bleed.
You used a color swatch that cannot bleed.

questions.question: 23. What are two differences between the PDF/X-1a and the PDF/X-4 PDF export presets?

alternatives.alternative: spot colors and bleed values
transparency and RGB images
compression and flattener settings
tagged text and accessibility options

questions.question: 24. Suppose you have selected a graphic frame that contains an image. Now you use File > Place and select another photograph. By default, what happens?

alternatives.alternative: The new image is placed inside the frame with the original image.
The new image is placed in a new frame in the same location as the original image.
InDesign displays an error.
The new image replaces the original image.

questions.question: 25. What does the icon to the right of the page thumbnail indicate?

alternatives.alternative: The page thumbnail in the Pages panel appears rotated.
The page appears rotated in the document window, but will print unrotated.
There are one or more items on this page that are rotated or flagged for rotation.
The page is marked to be rotated when exported or printed.

questions.question: 26. Suppose you place text in a frame, but the text is too close to the frame edge. What feature will help you adjust this?

alternatives.alternative: Object > Arrange
Type > Insert White Space
Object > Text Frame Options
Window > Text Wrap

questions.question: 27. Which feature helps you open or close sets of panels in the user interface?

alternatives.alternative: Window > Arrange
View > Screen Mode
Window > Workspace
View > Extras

questions.question: 28. Your document measurements display in picas. How can you change this to centimeters?

alternatives.alternative: Click Layout > Ruler Guides.
Click Layout > Numbering & Section Options.
Use the Units & Increments pane in the Preferences dialog box.
Use the Guides & Pasteboard pane in the Preferences dialog box.

questions.question: 29. How can you apply master page B to page 3?

alternatives.alternative: Drag master page B over the page 3 icon
You cannot apply master page B to this page
Drag the page 3 icon over master page B
master page B is already applied

questions.question: 30. Suppose you place text in a frame, but the text is too close to the frame edge. What feature will help you adjust this?

alternatives.alternative: Type > Insert White Space
Window > Text Wrap
Object > Arrange
Object > Text Frame Options

questions.question: 31. You are creating a flyer to be printed, and you want the background color to extend past the edge of the page. Which setting in the New Document dialog box will help you accomplush this??

alternatives.alternative: Slug guides
Bleed
Column Gutter
Margins

questions.question:
32. You are working on an InDesign document and there are guides on the page, but you cannot select them. Why is this? (select three items).

-A. The guides are on a layer that has printing disabled. -B. The guides are on a locked Layer. -C. The guides are being controlled using an object style. -D. Lock guides has been enabled. -E. The guides are on a master page.

alternatives.alternative: B, D, E (maybe)
C, D, E
A, B, C
B, C, D

questions.question: 33. You have an InDesign document with text on one layer and images on another. You want images with a text wrap applied to not wrap text when the layer is hidden. Where would you find the option to control this?

alternatives.alternative: in the Layer Options dialog box
in the Object Export Option dialog box
This happens automatically in InDesign
You cannot accomplish this in InDesign

questions.question:
34. You select some text with the Type tool, then click the Eyedropper tool and click a Photoshop image on your page. What happens? (Select three answers.) 
A. The color switches to black.
B. The color you clicked is applied to the text.
C. The color appears as a swatch in the Swatches panel.
D. The color appears in the Color panel.
E. If the image is in RGB mode, the text color is also set to RGB mode.

alternatives.alternative: A, B, D
A, C, E
B, D, E
B, C, D (maybe)

questions.question: 35. In an interactive document, you want two objects to fade in simultaneously on the page. Which panel helps you do this?

alternatives.alternative: Animation panel
Media panel
Page Transitions panel
Timing panel

questions.question: 36. What do you know about the selected hyperlink?

alternatives.alternative: The url is broken
the object is on the red layer
the hyperlink is stopped or paused
the content of the hyperlink is anchored

questions.question: 37. You have a paragraph style called Heading applied to text throughout a document. You modify the formatting of Heading in one paragraph, and would like this formatting to apply to all paragraphs with the Heading style applied. Which command would you accomplish this task

alternatives.alternative: Break link to style
Update Style
Redefine Style (pretty sure)
New style

questions.question: 38. What is a key difference between File > Document Setup and File > Adjust Layout?

alternatives.alternative: One lets you change the page orientation (portrait vs. Landscape)
One lets you change page size but not margin size
One affects all document pages and the other affects the current spread (maybe)
One lets you change the font size when changing margin size

questions.question: 39. Which feature is available for both the Adobe PDF (interactive) and Adobe PDF (Print) export options?

alternatives.alternative: hyperlinks
form fields
page transitions
audio annotations

questions.question: 40. How do you apply a Fade In animation to the selected object?

alternatives.alternative: In the Effects panel, select Fade In
Select Object > Content > Fade In
Select Fade In from the menu in the upper-right corner
In the Preset menu, select Fade In

questions.question: 41. What is the most important feature to use before sending an InDesign file to a colleague to work on?

alternatives.alternative: File > Export
File > File Info
File > User
File > Package

questions.question: 42. You want to move an image from one graphic frame to another. Which feature will you need to use?

alternatives.alternative: Edit > Place and Link
File > Adjust Layout
Edit > Paste Into
Object > Arrange
